page.title: 18LOW MOOR TRANSPORT MUSEUM
page.content: It is intended that a transport museum be built in Low Moor. The cost of the project will be about three million pounds and it will take above four years to build. One plan is to run old engines on the existing railway line from Low Moor to Halifax. Another is to develop a line to Dewsbury, but time needed to develop this is a big disadvantage. A local councillor who is backing the scheme has reservations about employing staff before the council has fully considered how the project might succeed. The first exhibits could be on show in 1986 and a number of souvenir shops opened. Some people think the museum will be a white elephant, others believe it will bring jobs into the area and become a major tourist attraction.
